net.grinder.statistics
Class ExpressionView

java.lang.Object
  net.grinder.statistics.ExpressionView
public class ExpressionView
extends Object

Associate a statistic expression with display information.

Statistic expressions are composed of statistic names (see StatisticsIndexMap) in a simple post-fix format using the symbols +, -, / and *, which have their usual meanings, in conjunction with simple statistic names or sub-expressions. Precedence can be controlled by grouping expressions in parentheses. For example, the error rate is (* (/ errors period) 1000) errors per second.

Sample statistics, such as timedTests, must be introduced with one of sum, count, or variance, depending on the attribute of interest.

For example, the statistic expression (/ (sum timedTests) (count timedTests)) represents the mean test time in milliseconds.

Author:
Philip Aston
